nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content: **1-The GitHub Trigger** node initiates the workflow whenever a pull request event occurs on a specified repository. It enables real-time automation based on GitHub activity.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
**2-Get PR Diffs**
The HTTP Request node fetches the list of changed files and their diffs from the pull request that triggered the workflow. It uses the GitHub REST API to retrieve this data dynamically based on the trigger payload.

{{ $env.API_BASE_URL }}{{$json.body.sender.login}}/{{$json.body.repository.name}}/pulls/{{$json.body.number}}/files

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
**3-Create Prompt from diffs**
This Code node runs a JavaScript snippet to:
-Parse file diffs from the previous HTTP Request node
-Format each diff with its file name
-Build a structured natural language prompt for the AI agent

The final output is a clear, contextual instruction like:
*"You are a senior iOS developer. Please review the following code changes in these files..."*

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content:
**Github Comment Poster**
Posts the AI-generated review as a comment on the pull request using GitHub API.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Code Review Agent
nodes.notes: This agent node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content:
**PR Labeler (optional)**
Automatically adds a label like *ReviewedByAI* to the pull request once the AI comment is posted.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note5

parameters.content:
**Google Sheet Best Practices**
Enables the AI agent to reference to your team coding guidelines stored in a Google Sheet for more accurate and opinionated reviews.
You can replace Google Sheets with any other database or tool.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Code Review workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Code Review workflow. This workflow integrates 9 different services: stickyNote, httpRequest, code, agent, githubTrigger. It contains 18 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 18
- **Node Types**: 9
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **OpenAI Chat Model**: lmChatOpenAi
- **PR Trigger**: githubTrigger
- **Get file's Diffs from PR**: httpRequest
- **Create target Prompt from PR Diffs**: code
- **GitHub Robot**: github
- **Add Label to PR**: github
- **Code Best Practices**: googleSheetsTool
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- ... and 8 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.
